If you're in the mood for a thought-provoking and visually stunning film, I highly recommend "Kundun" (1997) directed by Martin Scorsese. The movie follows the life of the 14th Dalai Lama from childhood to adulthood, showcasing his journey through Chinese oppression and other challenges. Starring Tenzin Thuthob Tsarong, Tulku Jamyang Kunga Tenzin, and Tencho Gyalpo, this film is a powerful and moving portrait of resilience and compassion.

Alternatively, if you're looking for a lighter and more comedic movie, "Friends with Benefits" (2011) might be up your alley. Starring Shaun White, Patricia Clarkson, Andrew Fleming, Rashida Jones, Masi Oka, Jason Segel, Mila Kunis, Andy Samberg, Justin Timberlake, and Woody Harrelson, this film explores the complexities of friendships and relationships through a series of humorous and relatable situations.
